bug.short_desc: PixPdqMessage.setField fail without explanations

long_desc.thetext: A message got the method to throw a null pointer exception at line 375 (seg.forceField) without an explanation why. Please add a check for a null Segment and throw an exception with more information to the user about what went wrong.
closing

bug.short_desc: Info: "Unable to update attributes for http://jira.codehaus.org null" in org.eclipse.mylar.core

long_desc.thetext:
It seems like this execution path does include know workaround and I still see this error (btw, search for duplicates does not work for this stack trace too):
-- Error Log -- Date: Tue Dec 26 17:32:53 EST 2006 Message: Unable to update attributes for http://jira.codehaus.org null Severity: Info Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar.core Stack Trace: org.tigris.jira.core.service.exceptions.AuthenticationException at org.tigris.jira.internal.core.service.soap.SoapJiraService.getProjectsNoSchemes(SoapJiraService.java:204) at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.initializeProjects(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:193) at org.tigris.jira.core.service.CachedRpcJiraServer.refreshDetails(CachedRpcJiraServer.java:117) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraServerFacade.refreshServerSettings(JiraServerFacade.java:117) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraRepositoryConnector.updateAttributes(JiraRepositoryConnector.java:319) at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.tasks.ui.ScheduledTaskListSynchJob.run(ScheduledTaskListSynchJob.java:100) at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)
I am still seeing this issue in v20070105-1700 build.

My current theory is that automatic updates for the repository attributes may kill the auth token if update takes too long. So, we could try to disable that automatic update for JIRA (completely, or have a checkbox in repository preferences that to disable that).
Other possibility could be to put some safeguard code around attributes retrieval or even run that in a separate job, to make it less destructive.

I've tried to debug it and come with the following findings:
-- Current JiraRepositoryConnector.ensureServerConnectionValid(..) method don't really do anything. The reason it works when user hit "Validate" in repository settings is because server instance is wiped out and created from scratch (effectively loosing any cached attributes). -- I've tried to explicitly logout using JiraServer.logout(), but it seems like there is a bug in jira core services, so even if logout method is called, locally cached login token is not reset.
All in all it seems like we can't do anything until this is fixed in jira core services.
Another weird thing in jira core services, that it swallow any errors during fetching query results and even it catches the auth exception login token also is not reset up there.
Created an attachment (id=56883) mylar/context/zip
*** Bug 170093 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Given comment#3, it looks like we're unfortunately stuck until the contribution for bug 165389 is approved.
Eugene: are you still seeing this on the latest dev build? It stopped happening in my workspace once I added the add/remove server code to the connection reset.

(In reply to comment #7) > Eugene: are you still seeing this on the latest dev build? It stopped > happening in my workspace once I added the add/remove server code to the > connection reset.
It works ok when you online, but I noticed that it still fail when system goes offline (or in sleep/hybernate). The major problem is that JIRA core services don't report any errors back and just return empty result on query request.
Also, that logging to stdout is polluting my console window and I may loose some stack traces now...
Unknown Issue attribute: parent Unknown Issue attribute: attachments Unknown Issue attribute: subtasks
Eugene: are you still seeing this?
I don't think original report is relevant anymore. Let's track further issues in a separate reports.

bug.short_desc: Debug setting "SuspendOnUncaughtExceptions" saved with wrong key

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Ensure Window->Preferences->Java->Debug->"Suspend on Uncaught Exceptions" = False, and Apply changes 2. Goto folder: <workspace>.metadata\.plugins\org.eclipse.core.runtime\.settings 3. Examine contents of settings file: "org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.prefs" 4. There is an incorrectly spelled key (missing period between 'ui' and 'javaDebug'): "org.eclipse.jdt.debug.uijavaDebug.SuspendOnUncaughtExceptions" 5. Cross-check this against the keys definition in source class "IJDIPreferencesConstants" and the typo error is clear.
More information:
My experimentation suggests that the correct key name should be: org.eclipse.jdt.ui.javaDebug.SuspendOnUncaughtExceptions
Changed IJDIPreferencesConstants. Makes pref names more consistent.
Please verify, Mike.

verified
"I could have sworn I turned that setting off..."

bug.short_desc: [launcher] System.out opens a new Console window in Headless RCP app

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create a Hello World RCP project using the standard wizard.
2. Change the 'run' method of the Application class by adding some Sytem.out.println() statements.
3. Export the RCP.
4. Launch a Windows DOS Shell, and cd to the folder containing the exported RCP.
5. Invoke the RCP from the command line, ensuring you use "java.exe" as the VM, as in the example below: myrcp.exe -vm "C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\java.exe"
6. Notice that the output of the Sytem.out.println() statements (inserted in step 2 above) appear in a *NEW* DOS console window that pops up. They should appear in the same DOS console used to invoke the RCP in step 5.
More information:

Is this related to what I see in my "headless" RCP app -- that if you throw an uncaught exception, the eclipse launcher / application framework catches it, and tries to display a dialog to tell the user "an error occurred, look at the log file"? Even -consoleLog and -noSplash aren't enough to stop the application from trying to create a Display.

actually, my previous comment is not another bug -- this bug is affecting us as well; we basically have a console app that does printing to stdout/stderr, and calling the eclipse launcher invariably creates a new command window. This is a killer for us being able to deploy this console application!

comment #1: There is a new argument to suppress dialogs from the launcher: --launcher.suppressErrors. See bug 172685.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 173962 ***

long_desc.thetext: Created an attachment (id=56193) Screenshots
Assigning to component owner PW

bug.short_desc: The "Debug View" cannot change the context of the thread for single stepping.

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. make some c/c++ multi-thread program. 2. continue until every thread is invoked. 3. change the focus to anthter thread from the last break-hit thread. 4. single-step -> doesn't executed in the selected thread.
More information: While debugging a multi-thread process, every time I try to do single-stepping on a different thread from the one that has got stopped the last time, the focus in the "Debug View" will be back to the stopped one. So I cannot change the thread context by the "Debug View" in order to let it single-step.
Is that a intended behavior?
Now, to avoid this phenomenon, once I let the break point hit in the thread that I want to trace and then I do single-step.

bug.short_desc: An Article on Dynamic Instantiation/Browsing Capabilities of EMF using Reflective Editor

long_desc.thetext:
Hi There
I have been recently working on Dynamic EMF and looking for help on the Net. during this search and implementation realised the use of Reflective Editor and Dynamic EMF. I am interested in publishing my learning on how to use the Reflective Editor to instantiate a Meta Model without creating any .java files.
I feel this would be a good contribution to the Eclipse Community as Reflective Editor is a less documented very useful feature in EMF.
regards Annamalai
I've sent a note to the emf-dev mailing list soliciting feedback for this proposal.

This sounds like a very worth while idea. When I demoed this feature an Eclipse Summit Europe people were very surprised to learn this capability existed and I got more of the usual comments about "you don't document all the things we can do very well"!

Created an attachment (id=57157) Article Draft 1.0
I am attaching a draft of the document to review. will soon move it to eclipse format.

Annamalai,
Probably you could say "due to the poor documenting of EMF" in a more diplomatic way. :-) Since your document will help make the documentation better, once your done, the documentation won't be so poor anymore.
In the GenModel and Ecore editors, we've implemented double click of open the properties view, so that might be worth mentioning.

bug.short_desc: [Perspectives] Enhancement: Save/restore perspective's layout by "instance"

long_desc.thetext:
[ Eclipse SDK, Version: 3.2.1 Build id: M20060921-0945 ] [ org.eclipse.ui.workbench_3.2.1.M20060906-0800.jar ] [ running on Windows XP with SP2 ]
Eclipse 3.2 currently supports save/restore perspective's layout, but for a single perspective id only last saved one can be restored lately. For example, If multiple workbench windows are opened with different workset, you cannot restore each workset with its own layout respectively.
Though maybe not a big problem for an IDE or normal tool application, it is rational to track layout of each perspecive instance for enterprise application, which can utilize multiple workbench windows of same perspective ID to show different dataset (probalbly holding as page's input). There are users who expecting that kind of behavior. Please consider to support this function in future.
I have worked it around with a few modifications for some internal class:
org.eclipse.ui.internal.Perspective org.eclipse.ui.internal.registry.PerspectiveRegistry
In my work-around, an input implementing IAdaptor is expected to return an optional IPerspectiveDescriptor object to identify each "instance" of the perspective.
class MyInput implements IAdaptor {
public Object getAdapter(Class adapter) { if (IPerspectiveDescriptor.class.equals(adapter)){ return new IPerspectiveDescriptor(){ //... }; } }
}
- Acquire for optional IPerspectiveDescriptor from the page's input.
- Change PerspectiveRegistry#saveCustomPersp(..) to save layouts twice, one for original perspective ID and another for the optional descriptor.
- Change PerspectiveRegistry#getCustomPersp(..) to load layout identified with optional descriptor if possible.
A fragment project with enhancements is submitted, please refer to it. It is quite a trick to be a good solution. I hope there will be an official improvement.

Created an attachment (id=56195) proposed patch
[based on org.eclipse.rcp.source_3.2.0.v20060609m-SVDNgVrNoh-MeGG\ src\org.eclipse.ui.workbench_3.2.0.I20060605-1400]
including enhancements for - save/restore perspective's layout by "instance" - control visiblity of restored views before displaying perspective

Feng, is the problem that when you restore your session, both windows end up with the same working set instead of different ones that they contained when shut down?
Or are the windows coming up with the same layout?
PW
(From update of attachment 56195) This fragment patching for bug 169113, too.

Reply to comment #2
Here is my use case in a Project Bugdget Management System that can handle hundreds of projects.
- A main navigator window for searching and listing matched projects.
- Open a new workbench window for one project selected, while a project object is assigned as input for the page inside the project window.
- A project window contains a set of perspectives to represent different tasks for budget management such as editing/browsing general information or bugdet items, simulating for both internal cost control and clients, and workflow control etc..
- User can open multiple project windows simultaneously, compare/copy/paste data between them. Multiple project windows hold a same set of perspectives but each for a different porject object.
- User can customize layout of each perspective in a project window, and their layouts is saved when close window, which are identified with it's project object (or input of page in workbench window). If re-open it later, perspective layouts for the project object will be restored.
You can see a perspective is "instantialized" for different input objects (or datasets). We want to restore session for each input objects respectively if possible. That's the problem.

bug.short_desc: An old bug for Rich Kulp

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: It is a bug, but the workaround is to change maChaine to:
String maChaine; // @jve:decl-index=0
This forces maChaine to be in the model even though there aren't any visuals referring to it.
Please create a bugzilla bug so that we can fix this for others. Please attach your class to the bug as a example of the error.
Also, please include the following text so that we don't need to reinvestigate the problem again.
------------ The problem is that String maChaine's bean was never added to the model. But there was an AnnotationEMF created for it. This had an annotates reference to it, but since the maChaine bean was not in the model, it was a dangling reference. The standard ResourceImpl expects references to have a resource, so that it can calculate the URI. But without being in a resource it didn't know what to do so it punted to -1.
Fix needs to remove Annotiations for any bean that is deleted from the model. It currently leaves them around.
More information: This bug was discussed in the news but seems nobody ever posted it.

bug.short_desc: Updated bug does not preserve values of custom fields in Jira

long_desc.thetext: When updating a Jira bug using the local task editor, the values of the customs fields, which are invisible in the editor, get wiped out as the updated bug gets submitted to the repository. I believe that, until the time custom fields are supported in Jira, their values should be left alone.
We should probably make them non-editable fields.

I suppose the actual problem is no values are provided for the custom fields in the HTTP post so they are set to an empty value. A possible solution would be to use the SOAP interface or to provide correct values.
Is it possible to post the same values for custom fields/values that were originally retrieved? This is pretty much how Bugzilla works.
I think the values are never retrieved.

I guess RssContentHandler would need to be updated and we'll need to extend org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.model to support custom fields too.

Looks like that custom fields are indeed part of the RSS feed:
http://mylar.eclipse.org/jiratest/si/jira.issueviews:issue-xml/JIRATEST-3/JIRATEST-3.xml
They are and state machin in RssContentHandler already tracking those elements, but don't saving them into the model.
*** Bug 160781 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
Steffen: is this still happening? If so, would is there a fix on the JIRA SOAP end of things that would resolve it?

Yes, the bug is still there. The SOAP interface has support for custom fields but we currently use the web interface via POST requests to update bugs. We either need to switch the code to use SOAP or add custom field support to our RSS parser.

Steffen, do you have any ideas how we could test this?
I have parser and some changes for update issue action, but want to add some tests before committing them. It also seems like I can show some of these attributes in the ui too (maybe hardcoding some of the stuff for now).

I believe Codehaus JIRA is using "participants" and "days since last commit" fields.

Error retrieving dependency of class: com.atlassian.jira.toolkit.customfield.ParticipantsCFType. Missing class: com/atlassian/jira/issue/customfields/impl/CalculatedCFType

Sorry, I misread the install instructions. Should work now.

-- blank but editable attributes doesn't appear in the RSS data, and as result we can't show them -- blank and read-only attributes (not only custom ones) are filtered out, because it doesn't make sense to waste screen real estate on them -- because of JIRA api limitations, we only support custom attributes in the task editor, but not in the new custom task editor
Anyways, doesn't seem like there is anything left here. Closing.

bug.short_desc: [render] "Compress package name segments" different on every level.

long_desc.thetext:
The function "Compress all package name segments, except the final segment" is nice. But it is not very suitable for large projects with deep package trees. Very often about 5 first segment are not needed at all (pattern "0"), but the next two or three segments are needed completely.
It is not possible in current configuration. All but the last segment are compressed with the same pattern.
It would be very good to have this function more powerful:
- Setting the length of the every level of the package tree would be very useful. Different implementations are possible. For example: using a pattern "0.0.0.0.4~." to change "com.company.department.team.project.task.subtask" into "proj~.task.subtask".
- The possibility to overwrite this pattern in project preferences would be very nice too.
All your point are valid, but we don't intend to work further on this feature. Contributions are welcome.

bug.short_desc: Make IDE#saveAllEditors work for logical models

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: 200610251409
Steps To Reproduce: 1.In RSA, make changes to a model under ClearCase control 2.Without saving the model, invoke Team->Checkin 3.Checkin succeeds but the user's latest changes are not committed to the repository.
More information: In the Logical Model API, there is currently no way for the repository to provider to query the state of the model and/or indicate to the model provider that it needs to be saved. The API needs to provide such a mechanism.

The problem is that IDE#saveAllEditors adapts the editor inputs to a file instead of a resource mapping. This should be a straight forward fix in IDE but will not work until models adapt there editor inputs to a resource mapping.
Created an attachment (id=56398) Patch to IDE plug-in

I have attached a patch which adds a ResourceMapping check to the IDE#saveAllEditors method. It would require model providers to adapt their editor part to a resource mapping. We can't adapt the editor input since it is possibly a file editor input due to how the workbench opens editors when a single file is clicked.
Before I check this in, I want to get Boris' opinion on this. Do you think it is OK to adapt the editor part to ResourceMapping? Also, is there some way to tie this to the underlying saveables instead (i.e. should we be getting the saveables from the part and querying them instead)?
Created an attachment (id=56399) Patch to PDE for testing purposes

Created an attachment (id=56563) Latest Patch to Workbench and IDE
Here's a version of the patch that uses Saveables. I think it is ready to go. Boris, do you want to have a look at it before I release it?
Created an attachment (id=56564) Oops, fixed a bug in the previous patch
Assigning to Boris for comment on patch.

If any of the save operations fail, would the new method return false (meaning "canceled")? The Javadoc should specify the behaviour for error cases too, or not talk about errors and cancellation at all, like in IWorkbenchPage.saveAllEditors(): * @return true if the command succeeded, and * false if at least one editor with unsaved changes * was not saved

It's funny you should cite that example because, from an inspection of code, the javadoc of IWorkbenchPage#saveAllEditors looks wrong. What is stated only applies if confirm is false. If confirm is true, then true is returned if all editors selected by the user are saved (i.e. some dirty editors may not be saved) and false if the user choose to cancel at any point during the operation. Also, if an error occurs when saving, true is returned regardless of what the value for confirm was.
I can fix the error handling so false is returned if there was an error during save and update the javadoc for all the save methods I can find.

Created an attachment (id=56830) Updated patch
Here's the patch with the updated javadoc and a modified save method. The save now returns false if the operation was canceled or if an error occurred while saving.
Oops - you are right about IWorkbenchPage.saveAllEditors. You got my point though - error cases matter, and the Javadoc should explain how they are handled and/or reported.
Fix released to HEAD

bug.short_desc: Code formatter: blank lines after last declaration
Dirty bit not set when EMF model is changed

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: I20061214-1445
Steps To Reproduce: 1. generate RCP runtime from model 2. load up diagram, change a property of the model 3. in order to have the option of saving, you have to modify the diagram, not the model (change the location, style, size etc)
More information: GMF 1.0 generated a ???DocumentProvider in diagram.part that had a private internal CustomModificationListener class. GMF 2.0 for RCP generates URIDiagramDocumentProvider in diagram.application which creates a DiagramModificationListener.
After some quick debugging, not terribly in depth, it seems that the listener is working, but it's set up to only listen to the GMFResource (diagram changes) and not to the XMIResource (model changes). That seems to be why the dirty bit isn't being set.
Changinh component - we can correct generation templates first.
additional comment, i'm using the N20061213 build of GMF.

I experience a similar problem. But not only the dirty bit isnt set when the EMF model changes, semantic model information isnt saved a all. When I reopen a diagram I created the way you do, all graphical elements are there (nodes, connections), but no property values were saved. Do you experience the same, or are your element property values saved once you get the option to save?
(In reply to comment #0) > Build ID: I20061214-1445 > > Steps To Reproduce: > 1. generate RCP runtime from model > 2. load up diagram, change a property of the model > 3. in order to have the option of saving, you have to modify the diagram, not > the model (change the location, style, size etc) > > > More information: > GMF 1.0 generated a ???DocumentProvider in diagram.part that had a private > internal CustomModificationListener class. GMF 2.0 for RCP generates > URIDiagramDocumentProvider in diagram.application which creates a > DiagramModificationListener. > > After some quick debugging, not terribly in depth, it seems that the listener > is working, but it's set up to only listen to the GMFResource (diagram changes) > and not to the XMIResource (model changes). That seems to be why the dirty bit > isn't being set. >

Ok, seemed to be my fault somehow. There must have been an error in a modification Ive made on the generated code. The saved information out of the semantical model seems to get stored correctly again. So the issue is just the Dirty bit I think. Just wanted to clear that up.
(In reply to comment #3) > I experience a similar problem. But not only the dirty bit isnt set when the > EMF model changes, semantic model information isnt saved a all. When I reopen > a diagram I created the way you do, all graphical elements are there (nodes, > connections), but no property values were saved. Do you experience the same, or > are your element property values saved once you get the option to save?
Generated code for RCP using the same ???DocumentProvider as non-RCP version from now. This problem should be fixed as a side-effect.

bug.short_desc: Created new Scripts view

long_desc.thetext:
Refactored the 'old' ScriptsView to ScriptsInfoView and created a new ScriptsView. This view shows a tree of all of the scripts available, allowing you to double-click on them to execute. Additionally, parent folders of scripts can be set to 'executable' to execute all scripts within that folder in a single step.
'Monkey' menu has become 'Scripts' to be clearer to end-users as to the intention of that menu.
This new view sets the groundwork for an interactive sharing system of scripts.
Created an attachment (id=56204) screenshot of new view
Created an attachment (id=56205) code patch
Forgot to mention that you can also edit the script from the new Scripts View. (see screenshot attachment)
(From update of attachment 56205) old patch, use new one
Created an attachment (id=57549) code patch

I installed the patch from comment #5. Opened Scripts view and Scripts Info view. In Scripts view, tried Execute on Hello>Bjorn, worked. In Scripts view, tried Edit Script on Hello>Bjorn, failed with error:
Error opening editor: org.eclipse.ui.PartInitException: Unable to open external editor for /Eclipse Monkey Examples/monkey/Hello__Bjorn.js.
In Package view, tried double-click on Hello__Bjorn.js, opened external editor (SubEthaEdit)
Using Eclipse 3.3M4 on Mac OSX 10.4.8

Tried using Package Explore "Open With.." to set the file association for a particular script file to the internal text editor. Then used new Scripts View "Edit Script" - same problem.
If we set the Preferences > General > Editors > File Associations > *.js to the internal text editor, then the Scripts View "Edit Script" works.
Patch not applied.
I thought I had a check to see if you do not have an associated editor in place for .js files, but I'll look it over and address this bug, thanks.
fixed has been checked in

org.eclipse.jface.text.reconciler.AbstractReconciler$BackgroundThread.run(AbstractReconciler.java:170) Apparently I there is something wrong with the template declaration/definition/specialization sequence parsing/interpretation. The patch attached helps the problem at least in a way that the content assistant start to work. It is not a bug fix, but rather a hot fix that is recommended before the actual fix become available.

Created an attachment (id=56206) Generic patch to block the problem until it is actually resolved.
It is not a real bug fix. But it makes the auto-complete feature work, except it does not show correct types for some items. Without a patch the feature does not work.

I can do something for this. The delegate must implement a addPartialSpecialization to correspond to the one in CPPClassTemplate. Probably means another one of those ICPPInternal* interfaces.
We seem to be dealing with variable whose type is a partial specialization of a class template that was introduced with a using declaration.
If this is not the case then there is something bigger going wrong somewhere and I would need a code snippet that reproduces it.

If you manage to drop a patch I'll test it. So far it sounds that you might be correct. I've tried to isolate the problem by dropping some headers, but the CPP output is still pretty large.
If the patch would not help, I'll make a preprocessor output and try to cut it down to reproduce the problem. Would take some time though.

I have released some changes to HEAD if you want to try it. The changes handle adding partial specializations for class templates introduced via a using declaration. As well as partial specializations of specializations of nested class templates.

There are two news: good and bad.
The good news: Content assist now works fine without patch.
The bad news: It does not recognise the variable type (no operators seen).
How shall we proceed? We can leave this one opened and I'll start figuring out how to create the source I can submit. Or we can close this one (no exception is thrown after all) and create a new one...
I mark this as a resolved as I have managed to track down the new problem and reported it as #169628

bug.short_desc: Wizard Error - WSDL2Java Uppercases First Letter of SOAPImpl Class

long_desc.thetext:
I created a query.wsdl file and used the Web service wizard to generate a Java skeleton. The wizard tried to open querySOAPImpl.java but created QuerySOAPImpl.java causing a file not found error in the editor.
Looks like a recent change in the emitter.
Pls fix the wizard so it opens the file actually created by the emitter.
I'll attach the wsdl and a screen shot.
I found this in WTP 1.5.2.
Created an attachment (id=56210) Screenshot of Java editor error.

Created an attachment (id=56211) WSDL File
Starts with lower case letter: query.wsdl
Created an attachment (id=56212) XSD imported by WSDL
Kathy, please have a look.
Mark. Please take a look at this problem. Thanks!

Created an attachment (id=57140) patch for org.eclipse.jst.ws.axix.creation.ui
The first letter of the binding name in this wsdl is a lower case letter. This patch simply capitalizes the first character of the binding name before computing the bean name.

This patch is ready for review.
I think this is the best fix for now. I tried digging into the axis code to see if I could find their algorithm for naming these things but that started taking more time than I had hoped.
WSDL2Java seems to spit out a "bindingName + Impl.java" file. If the binding name starts with a lowercase letter it is made uppercase. I tried a few other things such as inserting underscores '_' into the binding name to see what would happen but the rule of "bindingName + Impl.java" still applied, and the only change was making the first character uppercase.
Patch reviewed and committed to HEAD and R1_5_maintenance. Will release later today.
Released to R1_5_maintenance as v200701230511 and to HEAD as v200701230517.

Verified on WTP 1.5.3.
Thx Mark.
Closing

bug.short_desc: [Webapp] Create option to group search results by book

long_desc.thetext:
Searching help.eclipse.org or any site with a ton of books is effectively useless in my opinion ;/
Is it possible to group the results in some logic manner? Maybe by book? I know you can set your search scope, but who does that :) If you search all topics, it should have some type of clever drill-down mechanism or grouping mechanism.
An example of clever drill-down is clusty (http://clusty.com/search?input-form=clusty-simple&v%3Asources=webplus&query=apple)
What are your thoughts guys ;)
changing to an enhancement

Chris, we have this grouping ability already in the help view (Help > Search) as a toolbar button.. have a look. It doesn't do drill down but it's still useful for grouping. I would like to add this functionality as-is to the help window as a first step. Let me know what you think.

I think that would be a positive step in the right direction and shouldn't eat resources that much ;)
Thanks Curtis!
Done.
Thanks Curtis. I will drink in your honour.

Open preference page 'Java' > 'Compiler' > 'Errors/Warnings', expand 'Unnecessary Code' and set 'Parameter is never read' to 'Warning'

bug.short_desc: StructureBuilder cannot handle multiple packages/resources

long_desc.thetext:
2.0M3 (Similar but more generic than #141548, which is closed)
A model (such as QVT that extends EMOF) cannot be satisfactorily processed by StructureBuilder because not all EClasses are in the same EPackage or even the same Resource.
An Ecore model comprises EClasses which could each be in a distinct EPackage which could each be in a distinct Resource.
The iteration in StructureBuilder.process should iterate transitively over all referenced EClasses and all their super and sub classes.
Suggestion: in order to constrain the subsequent user entry, a per-EPackage include/exclude check-box would be helpful.

I can provide a patch for this, exploiting the recently added "Package:" combo to select the 'domainModel' on MapRefModelPages as a combo to choose which classes are presented as the 'domainElement's. Adding the same combo and sharing the code in DomainModelSelectionPage enables the graph and tool models to select the correct package as well.
ModelSelectionPage has to invoke EcoreUtils.resolveAll to traverse the proxies and load all models into the ResourceSet.
StructureBuilder and Hierarchy need to be more enthusuiastic in their selection of all classes in the ResourceSet as candidate classes.
I may well yet find more loops to broaden. What I have seems much better. Let me know when you want this in order to align with milestone freezes.

Honestly I'm not sure that we need such a complexity. The idea behind these wizards is to 'seed' graphical and tooling definition models with _some_ initial content; the ultimate goal is to create working diagram editor by a couple of clicks. This way toolsmith will quickly 'get in zone' when he will be able to evolve his project and won't be stuck in setup of numerous frameworks. Adding more features to these wizards will make them more complex and thus will slow down the toolsmith that's not what we want.

I second Dmitry. Moreover, for such complex models it doesn't seem possible to have reasonable defaults.
Though, contributions are welcome ;)

bug.short_desc: Copy from alternate file system doesn't work

long_desc.thetext:
Build ID: Build id: M20060921-0945
Steps To Reproduce: 1. Create an alternate file system by implementing IFileStore and IFileSystem 2. Create a link to the root of the alternate file system with URI uri = ... // URI to the root IFolder bin = myProject.getFolder(BIN_FOLDER_NAME); bin.createLink(uri, IResource.NONE, null); 3. Right click on a resource in the linked alternate file system and select 'Copy' 4. Right click on a folder in the local file system and choose 'Paste' 5. An error occurs: "Problems occured copying the selected resource" The detail pane says: "The location for ... could not be determined because it is based on undefined path variable"
More information: Debugging the code of interest yields the following situation: While cretaing the FileStoreRoot for the linked resource, the member variable localRoot is set to null. However, localRoot is checked in the File.copy(...) method with the method checkCopyRequirements(...), which tries to get an
IPath sourceLocation = getLocation();
I'm a little bit confused, if copy only copies local files. If so, why is the context menu for copy/paste enabled for linked resources?

I suspect this might be a dup of bug 163968, which I think was released with 3.3M4. It's a relatively simple fix, but I don't know whether it's on the list of things to backport to the 3.2.x stream.
Alex.

bug.short_desc: wrong character conversion in URL-Parameter

long_desc.thetext: When passing a special character like '' (&omul;) in the URL it is not correctly shown in the report. The charachter is converted to %f6 in the URL which is correctly converted back to '' in the request object in the doGet() function of the servlet container. Than BIRT converts the string in the class ParameterAccessor using the function toISOString using the following code ISOString = new String( s.getBytes( UTF_8_ENCODE ),ISO_8859_1_ENCODE ); This encodes the string as UTF-8 and constructs a new string interpreting the bytes as ISO_8859. The string is not converted but only interpreted as ISO_8859. Removing this translation (toISOString and toUTFString) yields the correct result.

Created an attachment (id=56221) sample report showing wrong character conversion
Publish the report using tomcat and call the url: localhost:8080/birtViewer/run?__report=umlautreport.rptdesign&UmlautParameter=abc%f6
The result should be the string 'abc' but 'abc' and wrong characters are shown.

This bug is because we get the encoding from the response is empty, then we will by default use ISSO-88591 to do the encoding. And for most of the cases, like Chinese, Japanese... are all correct. But for this case, the browser does the encoding for the special character, but we still can not get the encoding information from the response. We should not simple change the code here that will cause other problem for other special characters. So, if need to fix this, then we need to write the logic to detect which encoding that the browser used already.

Now viewer can conver most cases,such as Japanese char, Chinese char, English char, and so on. However, to correctly handle some special characters such as '' (&omul;) in this bug, we will have to justify the encoding of the value exactly that is returned by "requester.getParameterValue". It is an enhancements.
Schedule to future need more investigation.
Please try the latest build and use "&UmlautParameter=%C3%B6" to get '' charactor. You can use URLEncoder.encode( "","utf-8" ) to get this value. I have done the test. It works well. Thanks.

The problem is still present in the newest BIRT Version. The problem is in the Class ParameterAccessor where the Strings are converted from UTF-8 to iso 8859-1. The function toISOString is called with a String which is encoded in UTF-8.
The character '' is encoded in UTF-8 as byte sequence C3 B6. The code
ISOString = new String( s.getBytes( UTF_8_ENCODE ), ISO_8859_1_ENCODE );
does not create an ISOString. The function getBytes returns a byte-array of the string in UTF-8 encoding. This is the byte sequence C3 B6. The constructor for the String creates a String from the byte-array decoding it with the specified charset (not translating it in the specified charset!).
Copied from the JAVA-API-Documentation: --- Constructs a new String by decoding the specified array of bytes using the specified charset. The length of the new String is a function of the charset, and hence may not be equal to the length of the byte array. ---
This does not convert the String from UTF to ISO. It only takes the bytes of the UTF-8 string and interprets these as ISO 8859-1 string.
In order to convert the string '' from UTF-8 to ISO a mapping from UTF-8 to ISO is needed where each character is individually mapped from UTF-8 (e.g '' C3 B6) to ISO 8859-1 (eg '' F6). The byte representation of the ISO 8859-1 String created from the function toISOString is still C3 B6 which does not represent the string ''.
Which build did you use? I can't reproduct it. It worked well.

Created an attachment (id=80022) Screenshot of the debugged sample code
Here is a screenshot of the debugged sample code. Note the value of the variable notTheExcpectedIsoString! This is the result returned from the function toISOString!
What the function should return is in the variable expectedIsoString. Note the difference in the binary representation. In UTF-8 the string is 2 Bytes long (as is the incorrect result). The ISO-8859-1 representation is 1 Byte long!
"toISOString" function is only used to convert parameter name, not value. So if your parameter name contains this special char, it has this issue.

You are right. The same call is in the functions
String toUTFString (String s, String encoding) and String toUTFString (String s)
The parameter value is passed to the function toUTFString with encoding ISO-8859-1 which is then used in the call
UTFString = new String (s.getBytes("ISO-8859-1"), UTF_8_ENCODING);
This is still the same problem only the other direction. The resulting string is not in UTF-8!
Using special characters in the name of a parameter might not be a good idea. But the problem that the string is not converted in either toISOString or toUTFString still remains.

Hi Peter,
Which tomcat did you use? I remember the default encoding of Get and Post is different from tomcat 5.0. The defalut encoding of Get method is ISO8859-1. But BIRT viewer only supports UTF-8 encoding for URL parameter now. Please check it. Thanks.

(In reply to comment #12) > Hi Peter, > > Which tomcat did you use? I remember the default encoding of Get and Post is > different from tomcat 5.0. The defalut encoding of Get method is ISO8859-1. But > BIRT viewer only supports UTF-8 encoding for URL parameter now. Please check > it. Thanks. > Hi Jerry,
we use Tomcat 5.5.x. Are you trying to say that URL parameters in 5.5.x are encoded in ISO8859-1 and need to be converted to UTF-8 for BIRT?

Hi Peter,
yes. If you want to pass parameter in URL(Get method), you'd better change the default encoding iso-8859-1 to utf-8.
Please find the server.xml file under conf folder and add URIEncoding="UTF-8" as following.
<Connector port="8080" protocol="HTTP/1.1" connectionTimeout="20000" URIEncoding="UTF-8" redirectPort="8443" />
Now you can pass parameter as UTF-8 encoded string in URL. Please check it.
Thanks.

bug.short_desc: [PATCH] use server-minimal (if available) instead of server.xml for tomcat 5.x initial configuration

long_desc.thetext:
Current tomcat 5.0 and 5.5 adapters are using the server.xml file in the tomcat distribution as a base for a new server configuration. However, such files are bloated by a lot of samples and comments that are not needed in a runtime configuration; tomcat 5.x distributions also contain a clean "server-minimal.xml" file that would be better used as a base for such configuration.
The attached patch changes Tomcat50Configuration and Tomcat55Configuration in order to check if a server-minimal file is available. If server-minimal is found, it will be used as a base for the new configuration, elsewhere it will simply fall back to server.xml.
Created an attachment (id=56225) patch against WTP HEAD (2.0 M3)

Created an attachment (id=56261) updated patch with cleanup of duplicated code in tomcat 5.5 configuration
Please check this patch instead of the previous one. I realized that actually Tomcat55Configuration was a *complete* copy and paste from Tomcat50Configuration with no changes if not a couple of 5.0->5.5 renaming in trace logs. The attached patch makes tomcat 5.5 configuration a subclass of the tomcat 5.0 one (actually empty). The original change to server minimal is only in Tomcat50Configuration.
The patch also contains another minimal addition, the copy of catalina.properties to CATALINA_BASE (only if available, since it's not included in few old versions of tomcat 5.0): it's a small addition/enhancement that will not hurt and will more useful in future also for bug 124914 (could already be useful to users that needs to customize it without modifying the original tomcat installation dir). PS: see my comment on bug 124914 comment #52 , I was wrong saying that the adapter already copy catalina.properties, I was wrongly looking at catalina.policy, which is always loaded from CATALINA_BASE, the original adapter didn't care about catalina.properties at all.

bug.short_desc: multi-sheet/sub-set ecore_diagrams

long_desc.thetext:
An ecore_diagram is currently a very close equivalent to an ecore model.
This may be helpful for small models. It is almost useless for large models such as the GMF models, since the models are too complex to display on a single sheet.
ecore_diagram should support a multiple sheet diagram, such that each sheet contains no information that conflicts with the model. Compatible information should be permitted to occur many times on separate sheets or even the same sheet. (Each sheet is a View-of-the-Model, not the diagram is-the-Model).
Instantiation of material for each sheet could exploit an Outline in the same way as GEF's EDiagram.
It is of course necessary to distinguish Delete-from-View from Delete-from_Model edit operations. ...
[See also GMT/UMLX's multi-sheet Meta-model/Transformation diagrams which evolved from EDiagram and which I am about to reimplement based upon GMF.]
Is it a duplicat of https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=168322 ?

Re #2. Not really a duplicate of 168322.
Losing synchronization is anarchic. Multiple sub-set diagrams remain synchronized. (Delete a model element and the diagrams adjust.)
Adding Hide/Show is useful but a much lesser capability.
I was fishing for some insight into the long term goal of ecore_diagram. It seems there is none. I feel it should evolve from a useful GMF demonstrator to a first class meta-model editor.
If no-one else is working on it as part of GMF or an associated project, then I might extend its capabilities as the foundation of UMLX. I just want to avoid conflicting with or duplicating other activities.

Reply to comment#2:
In case of non-synchronized diagrams diagram element will be removed on deleting corresponding model element. The only one difference - newly created elements will appear only on the diagram used for element creation. (still can be added as a shortcuts to the other diagrams).
For me it looks like you are trying to find a solution for the same problem as described in request#168322. In this case it make sense to continue discussions there.
Concerning the contributions - you are welcome! Any requests I'm currently working on are marked as "Assigned" so for the rest of requests you can attach patches and I'll review it.

Looks like with implementing CanonicalEditPolicies as it is described in http://wiki.eclipse.org/index.php/GMF:_Synchronized_Container_Use_Cases this request will be covered (with non-synchronized or partly-synchronized diagrams)
Moving to the next version.

bug.short_desc: Allow CQuery specification on dependency

long_desc.thetext: Make it possible to add CQuery specification on a dependency. This functionality is required to increase the encapsulation of component specifications. Without this ability, all "fixes" needed must be added to CQueries (via advisor nodes). Someone downstream from a component can not reuse these fixes. By adding CQuery semantics on the dependencies is it possible to specify such overrides.

Actually this was not such a good idea after all. This solution to the problem of encapsulating constraints turned out to add more problems than it solved. Instead a new issue "Add a BOM Provider" has been added.
This bug is now closed.

bug.short_desc: Turn deprecation warnings into hard errors prior to 1.0 release

long_desc.thetext:
For the 1.0 release, the support of all deprecated pre-1.0 Buckminster XML Schema constructs should be turned into hard errors.
Send out message to newsgroups to allow those affected to make changes gracefully.
Sent out message about deprecation to the buckminster newsgroup.
Schemas were updated and deprecated handlers removed.
Released with 1.0.0.v20070108

bug.short_desc: CQuery patch via URL

long_desc.thetext: Currently it is possible to specify a local folder as an "overlay" folder. This is a patching mechanism used during a resolution. This should be changed to also allow the overlay folder to be specified via a URL to a zip file. The rationale for this is that it should be possible to share the patch with others - sharing the patch is typically done so that the remote party can incorporate the patched changes into their components/environment.
Remote zip and jar files can now be used as overlays

bug.short_desc: Buckminster as Corona Container

long_desc.thetext: Please add support that makes Buckminster act as a Corona container. This means that Corona users can share Buckminster artifacts for easy materialization of a complete environment.
